past.title: Cracking the code on weight loss - My journey during the pandemic - Small Talk #6

speakers.title: Hairizuan Noorazman, DevOps Engineer, Kiteworks

past.description:
110 kg to 80 kg?! Hairizuan went through a wild ride to achieve this goal - but how did he do it?

Join us as we explore his secrets, and learn how we can do the same, despite being in chairbound software engineering roles ðŸ˜‚

past.title: The Robot Uprising? Nah, Just 15,000 AI Jobs in Singapore! - Small Talk #5

speakers.title: Koo Ping Shung, Co-Founder, DataScience SG

past.description:
15,000 AI Jobs! This is the number set by the Singaporean Government, as part of the "National AI Strategy 2.0: AI for the Public Good for Singapore" from 2024 onwards!

This is huge news! Excited? Overwhelmed? ðŸ¤”

Join us and Koo as we banter over this very interesting topic on the 13th January 2023!

past.title: Laid Off? Level Up! How Two Ex-Employees Found Their Hustle - Small Talk #4

speakers.title: Hairizuan Noorazman, DevOps Engineer, Kiteworks

past.description:
Two GDG Cloud Singapore organizers were recently displaced - one from an unfortunate layoff exercise, while the other moved on due to intense office politics. 

Join this "Small Talk" podcast episode as we casually chat about what happened since the initial situation, and what we are up to since then.

past.title: Education, and the shift towards tech! - Small Talk #3

speakers.title: Soo Yuen Jien, Associate Professor, National University of Singapore

past.description:
In recent years, we have seen the technology scene taking the world by storm. Companies, be it big or small, have taken advantage of this wave of innovation to create more value for our society.

However, what does this change mean for us as individuals, and what can we expect to do for society and for ourselves? Our panelists - the Big O(n) Dev team - is elated to have Prof Soo Yuen Jien, an Associate Professor at the School of Computing in NUS, join us in our discussion of these current-day trends.

past.title: Software Developer Aspiration: Usain Bolt or M.D. House?

speakers.title: Bei Yi, Partner Engineer, Meta
Xiaodao Wu, Developer Advocate, Google
Sagar Begale, Developer Relations Engineer, Google

past.title: All about Volunteering! In Tech! - Small Talk #2

speakers.title: Michael Cheng, Lead Software Engineer, Govtech Singapore

past.description: Have you ever wanted to try out volunteering, but never got to do so? Or have you tried out volunteering, but facing difficulties in leading your community. If so, this will be an interesting session, where we will talk to Michael Cheng, a well-respected and 'OG' member for volunteering in the tech community.

past.title: Why Projects Succeed: Lessons Learned from the Android OS

speakers.title: Chet Haase, Android Graphics Engineer, Google

past.description:
The story of how Android came to be, and how it managed to survive and thrive in a crowded field of competitors, is an interesting story of people, teams, and vision. But it's also an educational tale of how products can succeed, which can help inform future ideas, startups, companies, acquisitions, and projects throughout tech and business overall.

This session will draw from the recently published book, Androids: the Team That Built the Android Operating System, to see what we can all learn from the Android project, which started as two people building a camera OS and resulted in a platform running on more than 3 billion devices today.

past.title: Growth Mindset: My Career, a Work in Progress

speakers.title: Nandini Javagal, Engineering Manager, Facebook

past.description: Most of our lives and careers have twists and turns. I am no exception. Throughout these challenges, I have learnt many lessons, taken the help from many! My journey is still a work in progress. In this talk, I will share my experiences, insights and a few best practices to incorporate a growth mindset into your own life and career.

past.title: Working Overseas? - Small Talk #1

speakers.title: Thye Yeow Bok, Head of Startup Ecosystem SEA, Google

past.description: In this pilot episode of "Small Talk", find out what it means to be working overseas, and experiences from doing so.

past.title: Avoiding the Engineering-Sales Breakdown

speakers.title: Andrew Lau, CEO, Jellyfish

past.description: We've all seen it throughout our careersâ€”the breakdown in communication and alignment between Sales and Engineering leaders (and by extension their organizations). We all know better alignment would be better for our companies, our customers, and our teams, but how can we get our Sales leaders to understand? Come discuss ways we can more effectively explain the work engineering does to Sales leaders, how we can drive alignment to ensure our teams are making the most impact, how we can put an end to all the finger-pointing.

past.title: Mentor? In Tech? - Small Talk #0

speakers.title: Julius Uy, VP of Engineering, Hubble
Jia Xin Lim, Marketing and Operations Manager, Google
Weiyuan Liu, Engineering Manager, Hubble

past.description: In this episode zero of "Small Talk", find out from this group of friends, what "Mentoring" means in the world of tech.

past.title: The Need for Application Security

speakers.title: Sean Wright, Lead Application Security Engineer, Immersive Labs

past.description: As companies move faster and faster in terms of getting content out in order to help enable them stay a step ahead of competition, the many approaches which we used to take for embedding application security into an application's lifecycle no longer scale. Combine this with the ever more pressing need to start paying closer attention to application security. The purpose of this talk is to express why application security is so important, now more so than ever before. This talk will also cover the different approaches which can be taken to help security aid in the faster pace which companies need to move. Finally this talk will also cover some of the challenges which organisations may face and how best to overcome such challenges.

past.title: Developer Productivity at Scale

speakers.title: Kent Wills, Director of Engineering, Yelp

past.description:
Developer productivity in a large organization can take many forms. Iâ€™ll share what it looks like at Yelp scale (500+ engineers). Iâ€™ll also share some best practices that we have discovered over the years and how to think about implementing them in your own organizations depending on the scale that you are currently at.


Watch this event at: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5QC-yRVb28Q
